fu.keys

Class LSIClassCentreDB

  • java.lang.Object
    • fu.keys.LSIClassCentreDB

  • public class LSIClassCentreDB
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the 'smaller' variant of LSIClassCentre. The entries are read from a deproDB, thus even older deproDBs with other number can be processed. In contrast to LSIClassCentre, this class statically only allocates the most important information about LSIClasses, i.e.
    • LSIClass number
    • LSIClass number end range
    • class token
    • class description
    • synonyms
    Developer should use this class and not LSIClassCentre, if LSIClassDefs have changed meanwhile, but older versions of the database should be processed.

      • initFromDB

        public static void initFromDB(java.lang.String dbParams)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        This method has to be called with a connection to a deproDB, before any mapping is executed. It can be called multiple time, but only the first time actually fetches the database entries.
        Parameters:
        dbParams - db access string
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if something fails related to the database

      • lsiClassRange

        public static int[] lsiClassRange(java.lang.String classToken)
        Returns the LSIClass range of an LSIClass, defined by a token. The range is an int[] with two entries 0: lsiClass (from), 1: lsiClassEndRange Returns null, if the class token is unknown.

        Returns:
        LSI class range

      • classStrings

        public static java.lang.String[] classStrings(int lsiClass)
        Returns the LSI Strings of an LSIClass, defined by its class number. The result String[] has two entries 0: token, 1: class name, 2: simplified. Returns null, if the class number is unknown.
        Parameters:
        lsiClass - LSI class number
        Returns:
        list of class strings

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(int lsiClass,
                                      java.lang.String realname,
                                      java.lang.String formatNoClassNoRealname,
                                      java.lang.String formatNoClass,
                                      java.lang.String formatNoRealname,
                                      java.lang.String formatRealnameIncludesClass,
                                      java.lang.String formatStandard)
        Creates string from LSI class and realname in a printf manner. This is useful, whenever a short description of a geo object has to be printed, e.g. "Restaurant Las Lunas". There exist some combination that make the printing complex, e.g. either class or name were not available. A special case: the realname incluces the class: if not considered, odd printings such as "Restaurant 'Restauraunt Las Lunas'" may result. To deal with this, the caller can pass up to five format strings. If null formats are passed, the next 'better' format is used. A format is an arbitrary string, that may contain some placeholders:
        • %lsinr: LSI class number (e.g. 16200000)
        • %lsito: LSI class 'to' number (e.g. 16299999)
        • %token: LSI class token (e.g. "GRENZE")
        • %Class: LSI class name i.e. its description (e.g. "Grenze (unspezifiziert)")
        • %csimp: LSI class name simplified) (e.g. "Grenze")
        • %rname: the geoobject's realname
        Parameters:
        lsiClass - the lsi class number
        realname - the geo object's realname. May be null, if there is no useful name available. It depends on the caller to decide this.
        formatNoClassNoRealname - format string, if no lsi class was available for the given number and the realname was null. Format may also be null.
        formatNoClass - format string, if no lsi class was available for the given number and the realname was available. Format may also be null.
        formatNoRealname - format string, if an lsi class was available for the given number and the realname was null. Format may also be null.
        formatRealnameIncludesClass - format string if both lsi class and realname were available, but the realname includes the class description or one if its synononyms, e.g. class="Steakhouse" and realname="Steakhouse Red Bull". Format may also be null.
        formatStandard - format string if both lsi class and realname were available, but the realname does not include the class description, e.g. class="Steakhouse" and realname="Red Bull". Format may notbe null.
        Returns:
        string

      • format1

        public static java.lang.String format1(int lsiClass,
                                       java.lang.String realname)
        Returns a string from LSI class and realname (that may be null). A format() call with predefined format strings, usually it outputs 
        class 'realname'
        , e.g. 
        Dorf 'Sulzbach'
        . The string is one of these cases
        • '???' if the object neither has an LSI type nor realname
        • 'realname' (in single quotes), if the object only has a realname
        • the simplified class name, if the object only has an LSI class
        • class name, 'realname', if the object has both and the realname does not include the class name
        • 'realname', if the object has both and the realname includes the class name
        Parameters:
        lsiClass - the lsi class number
        realname - the geo object's realname. May be null, if there is no useful name available. It depends on the caller to decide this.
        Returns:
        string

      • format2

        public static java.lang.String format2(int lsiClass,
                                       java.lang.String realname)
        Returns a string from LSI class and realname (that may be null). A format() call with predefined format strings, usually it outputs 
        realname (class)
        , e.g. 
        Sulzbach (Dorf)
        . The string is one of these cases
        • '???' if the object neither has an LSI type nor realname
        • 'realname' (in single quotes), if the object only has a realname
        • the simplified class name, if the object only has an LSI class
        • realname (class name), if the object has both and the realname does not include the class name
        • 'realname', if the object has both and the realname includes the class name
        Parameters:
        lsiClass - the lsi class number
        realname - the geo object's realname. May be null, if there is no useful name available. It depends on the caller to decide this.
        Returns:
        string
